body:
> Re: contingency plans: I'm open to enable aliases only when ALIAS_EXPERIMENT=1, but this is TBD.

That may be wiser until someone writes down an example of how aliases can be used to split a package up. Or maybe have the experiment on a dev. branch.

Aliases alone may not be sufficient to split up a package easily because types whose definitions rely on unexported objects could make the exported types impossible to move (since import cycles are of course not desirable).

On the other hand, if the proposal is simply about allowing a higher granularity in being able to rename objects at the package scope, such as math.Sinus into Sinus (which dot imports allow to do but coarsely) then I don't see any issue. People having a strong desire for generics may even get happy that way.

Perhaps I'm wrong but that's the extent of my understanding so far.
